name.text: 20.3.5.1 The Laplace transform of the delta function

questiontext.text:
The Laplace transform of the delta function

Here we consider \({\cal L}\{\delta(t-d)\}\). From the definition of the Laplace transform: \[ {\cal L}\{\delta (t-d)\}=\int_0^{\infty}\text{e}^{-st}\delta (t-d)\,dt=\text{e}^{-sd} \] by the sifting property of the delta function. Thus

Key Point

Laplace Transform of the Delta Function

\[{\cal L}\{\delta (t-d)\}=\text{e}^{-sd}\quad \text{ and, putting } \ d=0,\quad {\cal L}\{\delta (t)\}=\text{e}^0=1\]

Example

Find the Laplace transform of \(3\delta (t-3).\)

Solution

\(3e^{-3s}\)
